title: A way to run test.py on Ubuntu 20.04 (python 3.8)
body:
Seems there is no tensorflow 1.* in pip3 for python 3.8. And the latest tensorflow (currently 2.3.0) doesn't work with Ubuntu 20.04's keras. So I installed the latest keras (2.4.3) and the latest tensorflow (2.3.0) with pip3
```
$pip3 install keras tensorflow-gpu
```
Then I got this issue
```
/New/DenseDepth/layers.py", line 9, in __init__
    self.data_format = K.normalize_data_format(data_format)
AttributeError: module 'keras.backend' has no attribute 'normalize_data_format'
```
I found a solution from Mete Han Kahraman there https://stackoverflow.com/a/53442550
I added the following after import section in layers.py:
```
def normalize_data_format(value):
    if value is None:
        value = K.image_data_format()
    data_format = value.lower()
    if data_format not in {'channels_first', 'channels_last'}:
        raise ValueError('The `data_format` argument must be one of '
                         '"channels_first", "channels_last". Received: ' +
                         str(value))
    return data_format
```
Then deleted ```K.``` in this string:
```
        self.data_format = K.normalize_data_format(data_format)
```
Also to solve issue #138 I changed that string (line 38 in non-modified version)
```
        return tf.image.resize_images(inputs, [height, width], method=tf.image.ResizeMethod.BILINEAR, align_corners=True)
```
to this
```
        return tf.image.resize(inputs, [height, width], method=tf.image.ResizeMethod.BILINEAR)
```
A link with partial solution of the last issue I used
https://better-coding.com/solved-tensorflow-attributeerror-module-tensorflow-_api-v2-image-has-no-attribute-resize_images/

[layers.py.zip](https://github.com/ialhashim/DenseDepth/files/5007835/layers.py.zip)
